snippet: Angered by what he considers Japan’s efforts to sweep away the inconvenient truths of a nuclear disaster, a rancher returns to the no-man’s land near the devastated plant.
abstract: Japanese rancher Masami Yoshizawa moves back to his ranch to care for abandoned cattle in radioactive no-man's land surrounding devastated Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant; Yoshizawa's decision to defy government order to kill cattle is an act of protest, spurred by anger over what he says is the country's effort to sweep away inconvenient truths about the nuclear disaster.
lead_paragraph: Angered by what he considers Japan’s efforts to sweep away the inconvenient truths of a nuclear disaster, a rancher returns to the no-man’s land near the devastated plant.

headline.main: Defying Japan, Rancher Saves Fukushima’s Radioactive Cows
headline.print_headline: Defying Japan, Rancher Saves Fukushima’s Radioactive Cows
